title: What are the best Spanish rock songs to listen to? - Quora

response.answer_text: La Ciudad De La Furia/Soda Stereo Música Ligera/Soda Stereo Afuera/Caifanes No dejes que/Caifanes Como Te Extraño Mi Amor/Café Tacuba Solo Un Par De Palabras/Hombres G Mujer Amante/Rata Blanca Lamento Boliviano/Enanitos Verdes Mojada/Vilma Palma E Vanpiros Beber de tu Sangre/Los Amantes De Lola Camila/Fobia Malos Pensamientos/Miguel Mateos La Chispa Adecuada/Héroes Del Silencio La Carta/Héroes Del Silencio Entre Dos a Tierras/Héroes Del Silencio Flaca/Andrés Calamaro Cementerio Club/Pescado Rabioso Seguir Viviendo Sin Tu Amor/Spinetta Asustado Estoy/Nacha Pop Tren Al Sur/Los Prisioneros Lobo Hombre En Paris/La Union Oye mi amor/Mana Clavado en un bar/Mana Laura no está/Nek A tientas/Duncan Duh Cuando Pase El Temblor/Soda Stereo Prisioneros de la piel/La Ley Esperanza/Lucybell En esta habitación/Libido Kumbala/Maldita Vecindad This is very brief but it’s a starting point.

For me the best classic Spanish rock album of all time (up to the present) is Miguel Ríos’s live album ROCK AND RÍOS. He is as good as Bruce Springsteen, but totally original. In fact, he was a big name in Spain before Bruce. For those who prefer more of an 80s/new-wave sound, the best album is MECANO, the first one released by the group of the same name, with vocalist Ana Torroja. There are songs with absolutely infectious beats, like “Me colé en una fiesta” (I crashed your party) and “Perdido en mi habitación” (Lost in my bedroom). Both of these albums were released in 1982. I was fortunate to be living Spain at the time. People were rocking out, both Spaniards and foreign students alike, to the songs from these tremendous albums. My favorite song on the ROCK AND RÍOS album is “El río” (The River, no relation to Springsteen’s song though it is interesting to compare them). However, the album is very much a whole listening experience that one should do from start to finish. Or you can watch the whole concert:
